entries.title: Massive nursing degree scheme leads to hunt for 2,800 fraudulent nurses
entries.description: Delaware annulled 26 licenses. Georgia asked 22 to surrender theirs.

entries.title: ChatGPT sets record for fastest-growing user base in history, report says
entries.description: Intense demand for AI chatbot breaks records and inspires new subscription plan.

entries.title: Teasing out the secret recipes for mummification in ancient Egypt
entries.description: Most ingredients weren't available locally—more evidence of a long-distance trade network.

entries.title: Unofficial Link to the Past PC port is a reverse-engineered gem
entries.description: More than 70,000 lines of disassembled code teach an old game useful new tricks.

entries.title: Bethesda’s Redfall needs to be online for single-player mode
entries.description: Shooter continues the controversial history of the "always online" solo game.

entries.title: Up to 29,000 unpatched QNAP storage devices are sitting ducks to ransomware
entries.description: QNAP storage devices are a frequent target of criminal hackers.

entries.title: Netflix stirs fears by using AI-assisted background art in short anime film
entries.description: Netflix cites labor shortage, kicks hornets nest with AI-assisted 3-minute short.

entries.title: (Most of) AMD’s gaming-centric Ryzen 7000 X3D CPUs launch February 28
entries.description: 7800X3D launches in April for $449, while 7900X3D and 7950X3D are coming soon.

entries.title: Won’t somebody please think of the insects?!
entries.description: Global protected areas safeguard many plants and animals, but insects? Not so much.

entries.title: Apple should be required to let iPhone users sideload apps, Biden admin says
entries.description: Gov't report recommends laws targeting mobile "gatekeepers" Apple and Google.

entries.title: New data illustrates time’s effect on hard drive failure rates
entries.description: Backblaze examines 230,921 HDDs across 29 models from Seagate, Toshiba, and more.

entries.title: Paper: Stable Diffusion “memorizes” some images, sparking privacy concerns
entries.description: Out of 300,000 high-probability images tested, they found a 0.03% memorization rate.

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy S23 is official, with special-edition Qualcomm chip
entries.description: Samsung dumps the Exynos SoC internationally and gets a higher-binned Qualcomm chip.

entries.title: Musk locks his Twitter account to personally test reported malfunction
entries.description: Musk seemingly responding to conservative users reporting a Twitter malfunction.

entries.title: Antarctica’s only electric exploration vehicle gets an upgrade for 2023
entries.description: Venturi has added more cooling to cope with unexpectedly hot temperatures.

entries.title: Virgin Orbit receives another small investment from Branson—and it’s worrisome
entries.description: More clarity on the company's financial situation should come by late March.

entries.title: City planners are questioning the point of parking garages
entries.description: The car’s grip over city planning has been difficult to dislodge.

entries.title: Today’s best deals: Apple iPad Air, Meta Quest Pro, Surface devices, and more
entries.description: Dealmaster also has 4K TVs, computer components, and some of our favorite chargers.

entries.title: Intel cuts Arc A750 GPU’s price while boasting about driver optimizations
entries.description: Intel wants you to know that it's still improving Arc's buggy launch drivers.

entries.title: Two decades after the Columbia disaster, is NASA’s safety culture fixed?
entries.description: "We all know that to engineer is human."

entries.title: Apple’s Major League Soccer streaming service launches today
entries.description: It's a glimpse at Apple's original, fading vision for post-cable TV.

entries.title: The audacious rescue plan that might have saved space shuttle Columbia
entries.description: The untold story of the rescue mission that could have been NASA's finest hour.

entries.title: Pig-butchering scam apps sneak into Apple’s App Store and Google Play
entries.description: In online confidence scams, appearance is everything—and app stores can help with that.
